trueFalse.statement: The Burj Khalifa has 163 floors.
trueFalse.fact: Yes! Burj Khalifa has exactly 163 floors.

trueFalse.statement: The UAE flag has a blue stripe.
trueFalse.fact: The UAE flag has red, green, white, and black â€” no blue!

trueFalse.statement: Falcons in the UAE can have their own passports.
trueFalse.fact: True! UAE falcons get special falcon passports for travel.

trueFalse.statement: Dubai is the capital of the UAE.
trueFalse.fact: Abu Dhabi is the capital â€” Dubai is the most populous city!

trueFalse.statement: The UAE was formed in 1971.
trueFalse.fact: The UAE was formed on December 2nd, 1971!

trueFalse.statement: Machboos is a type of dessert.
trueFalse.fact: Machboos is the national dish â€” spiced rice with meat, not a dessert!

trueFalse.statement: The Sheikh Zayed Mosque has 82 domes.
trueFalse.fact: The Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque has exactly 82 domes!

trueFalse.statement: Camels can run up to 65 km/h.
trueFalse.fact: Racing camels can reach speeds of 65 km/h!

trueFalse.statement: The Louvre Abu Dhabi dome is lighter than the Eiffel Tower.
trueFalse.fact: The dome weighs 7,500 tons â€” heavier than the Eiffel Tower!

trueFalse.statement: Arabic coffee is served in large mugs.
trueFalse.fact: Arabic coffee is served in small cups called 'finjaan'!

trueFalse.statement: The UAE has 7 emirates.
trueFalse.fact: Abu Dhabi, Dubai, Sharjah, Ajman, Umm Al Quwain, Ras Al Khaimah, and Fujairah!

trueFalse.statement: The falaj water system is over 3,000 years old.
trueFalse.fact: The ancient falaj irrigation at Al Ain dates back over 3,000 years!

trueFalse.statement: Henna is a permanent tattoo.
trueFalse.fact: Henna creates temporary designs that fade in 1-3 weeks!

trueFalse.statement: The Museum of the Future is shaped like a donut.
trueFalse.fact: It has a torus (donut) shape covered in Arabic calligraphy!

trueFalse.statement: Luqaimat are savory meat pies.
trueFalse.fact: Luqaimat are sweet dumplings drizzled with date syrup!

trueFalse.statement: The UAE sent a probe called 'Hope' to Mars.
trueFalse.fact: The Hope Probe reached Mars in February 2021!

trueFalse.statement: Oud is a type of traditional food.
trueFalse.fact: Oud is a luxurious perfume ingredient from agarwood!

trueFalse.statement: Al Ain is known as the Garden City.
trueFalse.fact: Al Ain's lush oases earned it the nickname Garden City!

trueFalse.statement: The Palm Islands are shaped like stars.
trueFalse.fact: The Palm Islands are shaped like palm trees!

trueFalse.statement: The UAE Dirham has been used since 1973.
trueFalse.fact: The AED became the official currency in 1973!

trueFalse.statement: The UAE has a mountain called Jebel Jais that gets snow.
trueFalse.fact: Jebel Jais in Ras Al Khaimah is the UAE's highest peak at 1,934 meters and has experienced frost and occasional snowfall!

trueFalse.statement: Dubai is bigger than Abu Dhabi in area.
trueFalse.fact: Abu Dhabi is much larger â€” it covers about 87% of the entire UAE's land area!

trueFalse.statement: The UAE has a Formula 1 race track.
trueFalse.fact: The Yas Marina Circuit in Abu Dhabi has hosted the Formula 1 Abu Dhabi Grand Prix since 2009!

trueFalse.statement: Arabic is read from right to left.
trueFalse.fact: Arabic script is written and read from right to left, the opposite of English!

trueFalse.statement: Sharjah is the cultural capital of the Arab world.
trueFalse.fact: UNESCO designated Sharjah as the Cultural Capital of the Arab World in 1998!

trueFalse.statement: The Burj Khalifa was completed in 2015.
trueFalse.fact: The Burj Khalifa was completed and officially opened on January 4, 2010 â€” not 2015!

trueFalse.statement: The UAE borders Saudi Arabia and Qatar only.
trueFalse.fact: The UAE borders Saudi Arabia and Oman. Qatar is nearby across the water but does not share a land border with the UAE!

trueFalse.statement: The Rub al Khali is the world's largest sand desert.
trueFalse.fact: The Rub al Khali (Empty Quarter) covers about 650,000 square kilometers and is the largest continuous sand desert on Earth!

trueFalse.statement: Ajman is the largest emirate by area.
trueFalse.fact: Ajman is actually the smallest emirate at only 259 square kilometers. Abu Dhabi is the largest!

trueFalse.statement: The UAE national anthem is called 'Ishy Bilady'.
trueFalse.fact: 'Ishy Bilady' means 'Long Live My Nation' â€” it has been the UAE's national anthem since 1971!

trueFalse.statement: Balaleet is a traditional Emirati dinner dish.
trueFalse.fact: Balaleet is traditionally eaten for breakfast â€” it's sweet vermicelli topped with an egg omelette!

trueFalse.statement: The Arabian Oryx is the national animal of the UAE.
trueFalse.fact: The Arabian Oryx is the national animal of the UAE. It was once nearly extinct but has been successfully reintroduced into the wild!

trueFalse.statement: Fujairah is the only emirate with no coastline on the Arabian Gulf.
trueFalse.fact: Fujairah is the only emirate located entirely on the eastern coast, facing the Gulf of Oman instead of the Arabian Gulf!

trueFalse.statement: The kandura is traditionally black in color.
trueFalse.fact: The kandura (men's robe) is traditionally white. The black garment is the abaya, worn by women!

trueFalse.statement: Umm Al Quwain is the most populated emirate.
trueFalse.fact: Umm Al Quwain is one of the least populated emirates. Dubai is the most populated emirate in the UAE!

trueFalse.statement: Etihad Airways is based in Dubai.
trueFalse.fact: Etihad Airways is based in Abu Dhabi. Emirates Airline is the one based in Dubai!

trueFalse.statement: The UAE has no rivers.
trueFalse.fact: The UAE has no permanent rivers. It relies on groundwater, desalination, and seasonal wadis (dry riverbeds that fill during rain)!

trueFalse.statement: The traditional Emirati men's white robe is called an abaya.
trueFalse.fact: The men's white robe is called a kandura (or dishdasha). The abaya is the black robe traditionally worn by women!

trueFalse.statement: The UAE's national flower is the rose.
trueFalse.fact: The UAE does not have the rose as a national flower. The tribulus (Tribulus omanense) is associated with UAE flora, and the ghaf tree is the national tree!

trueFalse.statement: The Dubai Creek is a natural river.
trueFalse.fact: Dubai Creek is actually a natural saltwater inlet (not a river), which has been an important trading waterway for centuries!

trueFalse.statement: The UAE has a space agency.
trueFalse.fact: The UAE Space Agency was established in 2014 and has led missions including the Hope Probe to Mars!

trueFalse.statement: Harees is made with pasta and cheese.
trueFalse.fact: Harees is made with wheat and meat, slow-cooked until smooth and creamy. It's especially popular during Ramadan!

trueFalse.statement: The UAE's first Emirati astronaut went to space in 2019.
trueFalse.fact: Hazzaa Al Mansoori became the first Emirati astronaut when he traveled to the International Space Station in September 2019!

trueFalse.statement: The Al Ayyala dance is performed solo.
trueFalse.fact: Al Ayyala is a group dance where men stand in rows, swaying bamboo sticks in rhythm with drums. It is a UNESCO heritage tradition!

trueFalse.statement: The UAE grows over 200 varieties of dates.
trueFalse.fact: The UAE is one of the world's top date producers, growing over 200 varieties including the prized Khalas date!

trueFalse.statement: The Burj Al Arab is the tallest hotel in the world.
trueFalse.fact: The Burj Al Arab is iconic but not the tallest hotel â€” the Gevora Hotel, also in Dubai, holds that record at 356 meters!

trueFalse.statement: Summer temperatures in the UAE can exceed 50 degrees Celsius.
trueFalse.fact: During summer months, temperatures in the UAE desert regions can surpass 50Â°C (122Â°F), making it one of the hottest places on Earth!

trueFalse.statement: The UAE has mangrove forests.
trueFalse.fact: Abu Dhabi has extensive mangrove forests, particularly in the Jubail Mangrove Park, which are vital ecosystems for marine life!

trueFalse.statement: Thareed is a traditional Emirati soup.
trueFalse.fact: Thareed is not a soup â€” it's thin bread layered with a rich meat and vegetable stew. It's one of the most beloved Emirati dishes!

trueFalse.statement: Oil was the first major industry of the UAE.
trueFalse.fact: Pearl diving was the major industry of the region long before oil was discovered in the 1950s. Oil exports didn't begin until the 1960s!

trueFalse.statement: Ras Al Khaimah is south of Abu Dhabi.
trueFalse.fact: Ras Al Khaimah is in the northern part of the UAE, not south of Abu Dhabi!

trueFalse.statement: The word 'sheikh' means 'elder' or 'leader' in Arabic.
trueFalse.fact: The Arabic word 'sheikh' traditionally means an elder, chief, or leader of a tribe or community!

trueFalse.statement: Dugongs (sea cows) live in UAE waters.
trueFalse.fact: The UAE's Arabian Gulf waters are home to the world's second-largest population of dugongs after Australia!

trueFalse.statement: The ghaf tree is the national tree of the UAE.
trueFalse.fact: The ghaf tree (Prosopis cineraria) was declared the national tree of the UAE in 2008. It survives in harsh desert conditions!

trueFalse.statement: Pearl diving season in the old UAE lasted only one week.
trueFalse.fact: The pearl diving season (called Al Ghaws) lasted about four months, typically from June to September, and was extremely demanding!

trueFalse.statement: The UAE flag was designed in 1990.
trueFalse.fact: The UAE flag was designed by Abdullah Mohammed Al Maainah and adopted on December 2, 1971, when the UAE was founded â€” not 1990!

trueFalse.statement: The UAE was the first Arab country to send a probe to Mars.
trueFalse.fact: The Hope Probe (Misbar Al Amal) entered Mars orbit on February 9, 2021, making the UAE the first Arab nation and fifth country to reach Mars!

trueFalse.statement: A majlis is a type of Emirati bread.
trueFalse.fact: A majlis is a sitting room or gathering place where guests are welcomed and community matters are discussed. It is central to Emirati hospitality!

trueFalse.statement: The UAE has the world's longest zipline.
trueFalse.fact: Jebel Jais Flight in Ras Al Khaimah held the Guinness World Record as the longest zipline, stretching 2.83 kilometers!

trueFalse.statement: The Arabian Gulf is deeper than the Atlantic Ocean.
trueFalse.fact: The Arabian Gulf is relatively shallow, with an average depth of about 50 meters, while the Atlantic Ocean averages about 3,300 meters deep!

timeline.event: Abu Dhabi island settled by the Bani Yas tribe

timeline.fact: Legend says the Bani Yas followed a gazelle to fresh water on the island, and 'Abu Dhabi' means 'Father of the Gazelle'!

timeline.event: First treaties signed with Britain
timeline.fact: These peace treaties gave the region its old name â€” the Trucial States!

timeline.event: Al Maktoum family settles in Dubai
timeline.eventAr: Ø¹Ø§Ø¦Ù„Ø© Ø¢Ù„ Ù…ÙƒØªÙˆÙ… ØªØ³ØªÙ‚Ø± ÙÙŠ Ø¯Ø¨ÙŠ
timeline.fact: The Al Maktoum family moved from Abu Dhabi to Dubai Creek, establishing the dynasty that still rules Dubai today!

timeline.event: Pearl trade reaches its peak
timeline.fact: At its height, the UAE's pearl trade employed thousands of divers, and Gulf pearls were prized across Europe and India!

timeline.event: First oil exploration begins in Abu Dhabi
timeline.eventAr: Ø¨Ø¯Ø¡ Ø£ÙˆÙ„ Ø¹Ù…Ù„ÙŠØ§Øª Ø§Ù„ØªÙ†Ù‚ÙŠØ¨ Ø¹Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù†ÙØ· ÙÙŠ Ø£Ø¨ÙˆØ¸Ø¨ÙŠ
timeline.fact: International oil companies began surveying Abu Dhabi's desert and offshore areas, though commercial oil wouldn't come for over a decade!

timeline.event: Oil discovered in Abu Dhabi
timeline.fact: The discovery of oil transformed the UAE from a pearl-diving economy!

timeline.event: First oil exports from Abu Dhabi
timeline.fact: Abu Dhabi's first oil shipment came from the offshore Das Island field, marking the start of the nation's economic transformation!

timeline.event: Sheikh Zayed becomes ruler of Abu Dhabi
timeline.fact: Sheikh Zayed is known as the Father of the Nation!

timeline.event: Britain announces withdrawal from the Gulf
timeline.fact: Britain's announcement that it would withdraw by 1971 set the stage for Sheikh Zayed to unite the seven emirates into one nation!

timeline.event: The UAE is formed â€” 7 emirates unite

timeline.fact: December 2nd, 1971 â€” the day 7 emirates united under one flag!

timeline.event: UAE Dirham becomes the official currency
timeline.fact: The UAE Dirham replaced the Bahraini Dinar and Qatar-Dubai Riyal!

timeline.event: UAE co-founds the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC)

timeline.fact: The GCC was founded in Abu Dhabi with six member states: UAE, Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, Bahrain, Qatar, and Oman, to promote regional cooperation!

timeline.event: Emirates Airline takes its first flight
timeline.fact: Emirates started with just 2 planes and now has over 260!

timeline.event: First Dubai World Cup horse race held

timeline.event: Sheikh Zayed passes away; Sheikh Khalifa becomes president

timeline.fact: Sheikh Khalifa bin Zayed Al Nahyan succeeded his father as president, continuing the legacy of nation-building. The Burj Khalifa is named in his honor!

timeline.event: Burj Khalifa officially opens
timeline.fact: Burj Khalifa at 828 meters â€” the tallest building in the world!

timeline.event: Dubai wins the bid to host Expo 2020
timeline.fact: Dubai beat cities from Russia, Turkey, and Brazil to win the Expo bid, becoming the first Middle Eastern city to host a World Expo!

timeline.event: Louvre Abu Dhabi museum opens
timeline.fact: The Louvre Abu Dhabi's dome weighs 7,500 tons â€” heavier than the Eiffel Tower!

timeline.event: First Emirati astronaut travels to space

timeline.fact: Hazzaa Al Mansoori spent eight days aboard the International Space Station, becoming the first Emirati and third Arab in space!

timeline.event: Abraham Accords signed; Expo 2020 preparations finalized
timeline.eventAr: ØªÙˆÙ‚ÙŠØ¹ Ø§ØªÙØ§Ù‚ÙŠØ§Øª Ø£Ø¨Ø±Ø§Ù‡Ø§Ù…Ø› Ø§Ø³ØªÙƒÙ…Ø§Ù„ ØªØ­Ø¶ÙŠØ±Ø§Øª Ø¥ÙƒØ³Ø¨Ùˆ 2020
timeline.fact: The UAE became the third Arab country to normalize relations with Israel through the Abraham Accords, a historic diplomatic agreement!

timeline.event: Hope Probe reaches Mars; Expo 2020 opens

timeline.fact: The Hope Probe made the UAE the first Arab nation to reach Mars, and Expo 2020 Dubai welcomed 192 countries!

timeline.event: Museum of the Future opens in Dubai
timeline.fact: The donut-shaped Museum of the Future has no pillars inside!

timeline.event: UAE hosts COP28 climate summit
timeline.fact: COP28 was held at Expo City Dubai and brought together nearly 200 countries to discuss climate change action and sustainable energy!

timeline.event: Sultan Al Neyadi completes longest Arab space mission
